question: When you hear about a new invention, what makes you curious first?

options.text: How it is designed and built
What problem it solves using science
How it might improve people’s lives
How it could change daily life or society

question: If you visit a science exhibition, which section do you go to first?

options.text: Health, fitness, or human body displays
Information about how discoveries help communities

question: When watching a movie or show, what grabs your attention most?

options.text: The science or logic behind the story
How characters plan or run things
The rules, leadership, or fairness shown

question: If your school announces a new club, which one sounds interesting?
When you see a problem around you, what do you wonder first?

options.text: How it can be fixed or improved
Why it happens in the first place
How it can be managed or organized better

question: If you read an article online, which topic do you click on first?
When learning something new, what makes you want to know more?

options.text: Expressing ideas in your own way
Seeing how it helps people or society

question: If you could visit any workplace for a day, where would you go?
When playing a strategy game, what part excites you most?

options.text: Designing structures or tools in the game

question: If you join a group project, what are you curious to try?

options.text: Making sure the project helps others

question: When you hear about a new app, what do you want to explore?

options.text: How the app is built and coded
The idea or creativity behind it
How people might use or buy it
Whether it is safe and healthy to use

question: If your school plans an event, what part interests you?
When you read about a famous person, what do you focus on?

options.text: Their leadership or service to society

question: If you could learn a new skill just for fun, what would it be?

options.text: Learning about the human body or health

question: When thinking about the future, what topic makes you curious?

options.text: Scientific discoveries yet to be made
How societies are governed and improved

question: When you work on a project for many days, what keeps you interested?

options.text: Improving how it is built or functions
Making it useful or meaningful for others

question: Which school activity do you enjoy spending extra time on?

options.text: Learning how the body or mind works

question: When learning something challenging, what helps you stay focused?

options.text: Practicing step by step until it works

question: If you join a club, why do you keep going regularly?

options.text: You like creating and expressing ideas
You enjoy planning and organizing activities

question: When reading or watching content, what makes you continue?

options.text: Ideas about improving health or well-being

question: What type of assignment do you usually complete with care?
During group work, what role do you like to continue doing?
When practicing a skill, what makes you want to improve?
Which topic do you find yourself returning to?
What kind of feedback motivates you to keep going?
If you spend free time learning online, what do you continue watching?
When organizing an event, what part do you enjoy most?
What makes you stick with a difficult subject?

options.text: Applying concepts to real tools or systems

question: When leading a small task, what do you like doing repeatedly?
Which type of improvement feels satisfying to you?

options.text: Making a system faster or better

question: Which school subject feels most connected to who you are?

options.text: Subjects where you build or work with technology
Subjects where you explore facts and explanations
Subjects where you express ideas creatively
Subjects about society, rules, or leadership

question: When you imagine doing well in the future, what are you usually doing?

options.text: Helping people stay healthy or supported

question: What kind of task makes you feel confident in your abilities?
Which activity feels most like “your strength”?

options.text: Working with tools, machines, or code
Communicating ideas through art or writing

question: When choosing how to spend your free time, what feels most natural?
Which type of responsibility do you enjoy having?
What kind of success feels meaningful to you?

options.text: Making a positive impact on others

question: When you work in a group, what role feels right for you?

options.text: Making sure everyone is treated fairly

question: Which kind of learning motivates you the most?

options.text: Learning by teaching or guiding others

question: What kind of problem do you care most about solving?

options.text: Problems related to health or well-being

question: Which achievement would make you feel proud?

options.text: Making a scientific discovery or explanation
Helping someone improve their health or life
Leading a successful project or team

question: When learning becomes difficult, why do you continue?

options.text: You want to improve creative quality
You want to help others through knowledge

question: Which environment feels most comfortable for you?
What kind of contribution do you value making?
Which activity gives you a sense of purpose?
When making choices, what do you trust most?
What kind of long-term effort feels worth it to you?
When people ask what you are good at, what do you think of first?
If you chose one skill to deeply master over several years, what would it be?

options.text: Designing and improving technology or systems
Investigating questions and discovering new knowledge

question: What kind of work would you willingly practice even when it gets difficult?

options.text: Managing projects and making plans succeed

question: When you imagine being known for something in the future, what is it?
Which challenge would you enjoy improving at step by step?

options.text: Learning advanced technology or coding skills
Understanding health, life, or the human body deeply

question: What kind of long-term goal feels exciting rather than tiring?

options.text: Becoming highly skilled in research or analysis
Creating work that influences culture or thinking
Building systems that solve real problems
Improving how organizations or businesses operate

question: If you had to choose one area to keep learning even outside school, which would it be?
What kind of impact would make you feel proud after years of effort?

options.text: Leading meaningful social or educational change

question: Which skill would you want others to trust you as an expert in?
When you think about working hard for many years, what feels most meaningful?

options.text: Caring for people and improving lives
Serving society through leadership or education
